content.description: At first glance this seems like a slabby V-B but take a closer look and try the proper sit start, as most boulder should be done if possible, and you will find the problem to be a bit harder than perceived.  The crux of the problem is moving up to a single pad side pull crimp and bringing your feet out and around from under the sit start and onto the face.  After that it is done.  Almost a one move wonder.  Flexibility may bring this down a few grades.  I at first thought it to be V6 but then after a few sessions, sent it pretty quick and it felt more like a V3.
content.location: There is a nice nub for your left foot under the overhanging section and a nub further back in for your right foot.  You start sitting down with both hands on smaller obvious holds near the base of the face.

content.description: This one is very fun with a great crux for the grade.  Sit down start for full value and make your way up towards an arete like protrusion. Use crimp side pulls and body tension to make a big move up to an obvious jug. There is a slopey bump inbetween to make everything static.
content.location: Located on the cliff line in the shaded corner a boulder or two behind Pow Pow.

content.description: These boulders are located in-between No Named Balancing Boulder and the Mini Fortress Area but much closer to No Named Balancing Boulder. There is a small set of boulders with problems ranging from V0 to possibly V6. Most of these will be high balls which is typical of some of the cliff side bouldering throughout the park.
